website_summaries.verdict: For $79.99, you're better off buying a cheaper wireless keyboard than the Adesso WKB-3100UB--one that uses encryption and has a longer battery life for your sofa Web-surfing and portable-typing needs.

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard dying prematurely
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of minimum use on my living room home theater system, the trackball has become unusable... erratic and extremely slow. It is used in a clean environment and the keyboard was never dropped or otherwise abused. After reading other reviews here and on other sites, I realize I wasted my money. Just as well as it's an ergonomically challenged keyboard anyway. It's clumsy and difficult to move around within living room seating area as there are no handles nor non-key space in order to grab it. And it requires two-hands to operate as there's no buttons on the right side, near the trackball.
customer_reviews.author: Pat the Rat

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: my last little Adesso keyboard lasted me about 3 years until the ctrl key stopped working. it is a loud keyboard ill note that especially the new models out (slimtouch 3100) i also used it for gaming which says something. but what i noticed about these new ones is the reciever isnt nearly as good as the last one, well for me atleast, ill update when i put it to the test but so far the day i got it i noticed some differences. Also it seemed a little difficult to get the reciever to acknowledge the keyboard and it not that hard. but i will change this review soon like a said after a week or so.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Biber

customer_reviews.title: I have a room divider with my home office on ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a room divider with my home office on one side, and TV/entertainment center on the other. Have my TV hooked up to my computer on the other side of the room divider, and this keyboard makes browsing the web on the TV convenient.
customer_reviews.author: The Reluctant Bear

customer_reviews.title: It worked well, but conked out too soon.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard, but because the trackball is so small, it’s kind of hard for me to control (I’m a quadriplegic, so I have very little finger or hand movement). To remedy that, I bought a large trackball mouse. Then, after several months, various keys on the keyboard stopped working, culminating in the entire keyboard giving up the ghost. I would like to get another one, however, since I use an identical keyboard at work.
customer_reviews.author: Quad Xoch

customer_reviews.title: I just got it but it seems to be of good quality
customer_reviews.text: the keyboard has some weight to it it looks really nice too and is functioning just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard On Amazon

customer_reviews.title: It can work, but can be frustrating
customer_reviews.text: The wireless aspect is amazing, but it can go in and out depending on its angle and how its positioned if it is in your lap. A major turn off is the lack of a scroll wheel. Each item stated adds to a good bit of frustration to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it...
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the bad reviews but I didn't want to believe them. Very squishy keys. Delayed response time. Didn't look exactly like the picture on Amazon. I literally picked it up at the end of the day and walked straight over to the trash can and dropped it in.
customer_reviews.author: T-Ray

customer_reviews.title: Dont Last Long
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered about 30 of these over the last 2 years for a client of mine. These keyboards usually last them about 6-9 months before the trackball or mouse buttons will completely fail. Great product in theory, but does not stand up to daily use.
customer_reviews.author: SunsetTechnologies

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I had another mini keyboard that died on me so I purchased this one. It is excellent if you are looking for something where you can talk to someone and type with it sitting on your lap. The build quality is very good, and I really like how effortless the keys are while typing. I would definitley buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: MCW

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: It works for what I use it for. The 4 star is it could of used a scroll wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Honkin

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's got really poor reception and range. It'll start to cut out after 6 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Khalil Y.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. Very sensitive/reactive track ball.
customer_reviews.text: The track ball is VERY sensitive, the slightest move causes a great move on the screen. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really good wireless connection. I use it in my classroom
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more than 10 foot range
customer_reviews.text: The device is very attractive and easy to install. Remember to press the Numlock when you first turn it on or numbers will type when pressing some letters. I can only recommend this if you are line of sight and no more than 10 feet away from your PC. I needed this to go 15 feet through one wall and there is just no way. Couldn't get a single character to type. Don't even think about it if you are more than 10 feet. Wireless rangle on website is listed as "Up to 100 feet". The Instruction Manual "says 30 feet" - both were wrong no matter how hard I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Electronics Nut

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Extremely poor quality. Both units I purchased stopped working within 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Howie

customer_reviews.title: Trackball useless
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size of the typewriter and all was working well but after a few months the trackball stopped responding properly even when you are near the receiver. After a few days it might work again and after some time it stops responding again. It looks like the camera or censors are not recognizing the movements of the ball above. Very frustrating and waste of money. I have to buy a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Camilleri

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Keyboard w/trackball
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard works well an has good range. The only needed improvement is a Num Lock light so you can tell when it is on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not full size, Space key jams
customer_reviews.text: 1) It's not a perfect keyboard for heavy blogging or serious typing. I feel it's not a full sized keyboard. 2) Space key need extra effort to press, otherwise you feels jammed andallyourstufflookslikethis. 3) Wireless works fine within living room range. 4) Trackball is not accurate. For casual couch user, it's okay. If you work from living room, this is not for you. ---- Update ---- I actually returned to Amazon after several days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short range
customer_reviews.text: Small size, convenient for htpc. I would prefer mice buttons lay out on the right side next to the track ball and bold letters. The range is short. It doesn't work at all when receiver inserted to the back usb port had to put it in to front usb which is not nice.
customer_reviews.author: A. Azriel

customer_reviews.title: Wireless feature is not stable
customer_reviews.text: I have used wireless keyboards for years and was attracted to this because it is compact. It is probably the most finicky one I have had. The best I have had is the Logitech Edge.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Schlough

customer_reviews.title: Trackball usage is weird; too easy to hit num-lock.
customer_reviews.text: The feel of this keyboard isn't bad. Decent travel in the keys. The backspace key is too small, so it's hard to backup without looking, but you get used to that. The trackball is really quite weird and needs two hands (right hand to move mouse, left hand to hit buttons). And there's no scrollwheel (which I miss more than i expected). The most unexpected problem is that I keep accidentally hitting num-lock and end up typing numbers instead of letters. Pain in the.... If you can deal with the trackball, then this might work for you. I personally like the touchpad keyboards better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre range, recplacement RCV-24G receiver only available on ebay
customer_reviews.text: I only get about 10 feet of range and the USB receiver is not generally available if you lose it, even directly from Adesso. It's also about half the value of the keyboard, which is ridiculous. The keyboard itself has responsive keys and is pleasant to type on.
customer_reviews.author: robdew

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Placement of several of the keys is poor. The backspace is buried among other keys. I use it as HTC keyboard so lights are usually low and it's hard to find the backspace. Had to color it in with silver sharpie. Also the trackball is very sensitive so I would not think you could use it regularly, but for HTC it works great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Even thou it's big, the mouse ball works very well. And the response time is good.
customer_reviews.author: X. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good keyboard. I like the size, its perfect. There's only one reason why I did not give it 5 stars ... I hate the placement of the "Delete" key (bottom row under shift key). On most keyboards, this is the last key on the top row. It doesn't seem like this is a big deal, but it is, and I'm having problems adjusting to it. BTW ... the "Insert" key is on the bottom row also ... don't like that either.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia C.

product_meta.title: Adesso 2.4 GHz RF Wireless Mini Trackball Keyboard (WKB-3100UB), Black
product_meta.description: The Adesso Wireless Mini Trackball Keyboard provides optimum control of your computer at a distance of up to 30 feet away. The integrated trackball and mouse buttons provide you with all the features of a mouse, but without the need of an additional accessory. The trackball delivers superior precision and smooth motion with no maintenance or cleaning required. This keyboard is perfect for compact spaces like small office cubicles, home offices and kiosks. This unique keyboard also works great with PC systems, LCD monitors and Tablet PCs in both your home and office. The keyboard is compact and is also extremely mobile, fitting easily in a briefcase or backpack. Windows 7, Vista, XP or 2000
feature_bullets: 2.4GHz RF Wireless Technology with 12 Channels (65000 IDs per Channel)
Power ON/OFF Switch for Increased Energy Saving
